CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Furthermore , BHJ PSCs based on PffBB-12 , PffBB-14 , and PffBB-16 also exhibited the same trend in which their highest PCE was achieved by spin - coating the active blend layer at 80 °C .

Let's think step by step.

1. BHJ PSCs: Blend of Hole Transporting and Electron Transporting materials in Bulk Heterojunction solar cells.
2. PffBB-12, PffBB-14, PffBB-16: These are likely the names of specific materials used in the BHJ PSCs. They could be specific types of Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate) (PEO:PSS) or other types of materials used as the polymer component in the active blend layer. The exact nature of these materials would need to be determined through additional context or research.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.
1. PffBB-12, PffBB-14, PffBB-16: These are likely the names of specific materials used in the BHJ PSCs.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Furthermore , BHJ PSCs based on PffBB-12 , PffBB-14 , and PffBB-16 also exhibited the same trend in which their highest PCE was achieved by spin - coating the active blend layer at 80 °C .

Let's think step by step.

1. BHJ PSCs (Blends of Hole Transporting and Electron Transporting materials in Organic Photovoltaic Cells)
2. PffBB-12, PffBB-14, PffBB-16 (specific types of Blends used in BHJ PSCs)
3. Highest PCE (Highest Power Conversion Efficiency)
4. Spin-coating (Method of applying a material as a thin coating)
5. Active blend layer (The layer of the material that is responsible for the electrical conductivity and charge transport in the BHJ PSC)
6. 80 °C (Temperature)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. BHJ PSCs (Organic Photovoltaic Cells)
2. PffBB-12, PffBB-14, PffBB-16 (Specific types of materials used in BHJ PSCs)
3. Highest PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency, a material property)
4. 80 °C (Temperature)

These are the entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to material properties. The other entities, such as "Furthermore," "exhibited the same trend," "in which," "their," "highest," "spin-coating," "active blend layer," and "Method of applying a material as a thin coating," do not directly refer to material properties.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| BHJ PSCs (Organic Photovoltaic Cells) |
| PffBB-12, PffBB-14, PffBB-16 (specific types of Blends used in BHJ PSCs) |
| Highest Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE) |
| 80 °C (Temperature) |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Furthermore , BHJ PSCs based on PffBB-12 , PffBB-14 , and PffBB-16 also exhibited the same trend in which their highest PCE was achieved by spin - coating the active blend layer at 80 °C .

Let's think step by step.

1. BHJ PSCs: BHJ (Bulk Heterojunction) Polymer Solar Cells
2. PffBB-12, PffBB-14, PffBB-16: Specific types of Polymer Fullerene Blend Binaries.
3. Highest PCE: Peak Cell Efficiency
4. Spin-coating: A method used to apply a thin coating of a material onto a substrate by spinning the substrate at high speed while the material is being coated onto it.
5. Active blend layer: The layer in a polymer solar cell that contains the active materials (polymer and fullerene) that generate electricity when exposed to light.
6. 80 °C: Temperature.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. Highest PCE: Peak Cell Efficiency
2. 80 °C: Temperature (the temperature value that achieves the highest cell efficiency)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Highest PCE (Peak Cell Efficiency) |
| 80 °C (Temperature) |
